newsitem.title: USA: GOLF-LOVE BEATS MICKELSON TO WIN U.S. CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH PLAY.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-LOVE BEATS MICKELSON TO WIN U.S. CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH PLAY.

text.p: Davis Love III
with a tap-in birdie on the second playoff hole, beat Phil
Mickelson to win the U.S. Championship leg of the World
Chamionship of golf on Tuesday.
Love's victory makes him the second regional champion
after Hajime Meshiai of Japan to qualify for the match play
tournament at the World Finals in January, 1998, in
Scottsdale, Arizona.
In a see-saw battle, neither player had more than a 1-up
lead throughout the match.
On the first playoff hole, the 457-yard 16th, Love and
Mickelson made lengthy par putts after aggressive first putts
at birdie rolled by the hole. At the 17th, Love staked a
7-iron to two feet to claim the title.
"It was my best shot of the tournament," Love, 32, said.
"The first time I misclubbed, and it helped me the second time
we played 17.
"The match wasn't pretty, but it was nice to end with a
good shot," said Love, who won $200,000 for his victory to add
to the $70,000 he won by beating Lehman, 3-2, earlier in the
day and $20,000 for defeating Corey Pavin, 5-3, on Monday.
Mickelson won $150,000 as runnerup. He also won a total of
$90,000 for beating Fred Couples and Mark O'Meara in earlier
rounds.
